Title: New species and new records of Meliolaceae from Panama
Keywords:
Appendiculella, Ascomycota, Asteridiella, black mildews,
Irenopsis, Meliola, Meliolaceae, tropical plant parasitic fungi
Abstract:
In a phylogenetic hypothesis based on 28S nrDNA sequences,
the position of Meliolales basal to Sordariomycetidae and
Hypocreomycetidae within Sordariomycetes is confirmed. Species of
Appendiculella and Asteridiella are included in a DNA sequence analysis
for the first time and are resolved as more closely related to each
other than to Meliola. The three new species of Meliolaceae described by
material collected in Panama include Appendiculella monsterae on
Monstera deliciosa (Araceae), Asteridiella nitidae on Buddleja nitida
(Scrophulariaceae), and Irenopsis chrysophylli on Chrysophyllum sp.
(Sapotaceae). Twenty one Meliolaceae are reported for the first time for
Panama and six species of plants are cited as hosts for meliolaceous
fungi for the first time.
